required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vyvanse and Glucose Intolerance in Children With Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Vyvanse and Glucose Intolerance in Children With ADHD and Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study to assess the effects of chronic administration of Vyvanse (lis-dexamphetamine) on glucose metabolism in a sample of children and adolescents with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) who also have glucose intolerance and are obese.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Due very high screen fail rate, pre study feasibility not consistent with screened population.

primary_outcome.measure: Pre and Post Study Fasting Blood Sugar and Two Hour Post Prandial.
primary_outcome.description: The study was terminated due to lack of enrollment therefore outcome measures were not assessed. If completed, the expected outcomes would have shown an improvement of the subject's fasting and 2 hour post prandial glucose values, insulin levels and HbA1c. However, all of the subjects recruited did not have abnormal values to start with. The two subjects who were enrolled were the younger kids to which the entry lab criteria do not apply.

arm_group.description: Eligible subjects will be dispensed open label LDX (VyvanseTM). All subjects will start at 20 mg once a day dose and will be titrated up weekly by 10 mg increments up to a maximum dose of 70 mg. If a subject experiences intolerable side effects at a particular dose, a step down to the next tolerated level is allowed.

intervention.description: Eligible subjects will be dispensed open label LDX (VyvanseTM). All subjects will start at 20 mg once a day dose and will be titrated up weekly by 10 mg increments up to a maximum dose of 70 mg. If a subject experiences intolerable side effects at a particular dose, a step down to the next tolerated level is allowed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female, ages between 8 and 17
- Body Mass Index > 30
- fasting blood sugar between 90-100 mg/dl
- 2 hour post prandial >140 <180 mg/dl
- meets criteria for a diagnosis of ADHD, any subtype
Exclusion Criteria:
- known cardiovascular disease or diabetes
- structural cardiac abnormalities, abnormal ECGs, family history of sudden death
- positive urine drug screen
- fasting blood sugar level > 126 mg/dl
- HbA1c > 6.5 %
- Weight > 300 lbs

facility.name: Duke Child and Family Study Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Potential participants are pre-screened at the Duke Obesity Clinic. Eligible participants then come to the Duke ADHD Clinic for their first study visit.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: At the screening visit, psychiatric evaluation and fasting labs were obtained to determine eligibility. Of the 14 subjects only 2 qualified and received study drug. Reasons for screen fails: 8-did not meet lab parameters for glucose intolerance, 1-elevated BP, 1- elevated TSH, 1- doing well with current ADHD treatment, 1- diagnosed with depression.

group.title: Open Label Vyvanse
group.description: Eligible subjects will be dispensed open label LDX (Vyvanse). All subjects will start at 20 mg once a day dose and will be titrated up weekly by 10 mg increments up to a maximum dose of 70 mg. If a subject experiences intolerable side effects at a particular dose, a step down to the next tolerated level is allowed.

participants_list.participants: A total of 14 participants screened: 2 qualified and received drug the remaining 12 failed screen

outcome.title: Pre and Post Study Fasting Blood Sugar and Two Hour Post Prandial.
outcome.description: The study was terminated due to lack of enrollment therefore outcome measures were not assessed. If completed, the expected outcomes would have shown an improvement of the subject's fasting and 2 hour post prandial glucose values, insulin levels and HbA1c. However, all of the subjects recruited did not have abnormal values to start with. The two subjects who were enrolled were the younger kids to which the entry lab criteria do not apply.
outcome.population: Study terminated early - no analysis performed on the single subject with data.

group.title: Vyvanse Open Label
group.description: Eligible subjects were dispensed open label LDX (VyvanseTM). All subjects started at 20 mg once a day dose and were titrated up weekly by 10 mg increments up to a maximum dose of 70 mg. If a subject experiences intolerable side effects at a particular dose, a step down to the next tolerated level was allowed.

group.title: Open Label Vyvanse
group.description: Eligible subjects will be dispensed open label LDX (VyvanseTM). All subjects will start at 20 mg once a day dose and will be titrated up weekly by 10 mg increments up to a maximum dose of 70 mg. certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study was terminated due to the high number of failures of lab criteria for glucose intolerance which is one of the entry criterion. No data were analyzed.
